p: Results of in vitro experiments using B. sempervirens hydro-alcoholic extract revealed that this extract has a negative effect on the germination of I. fumosorosea conidia ( Figure 5). In the control treated by solvent, the mean germination was 100% (SE = 0, n = 3), while on extract-treated agar, the mean germination was only 92.67% (SE = 0.88, n = 3) in average. The difference was statistically highly significant (Ï‡ 2 = 31.36, df = 1, p < 0.0001).
